channel.title: Drum and Bass in your face!
channel.description:
Check out my latest music track:
Download MP3: [url=https://www.hamsteralliance.com/music/2009/THA-solarphage.mp3][b]THA - Solarphage.mp3[/b][/url]
It's Drum and Bass of the loud and heavy variety. 181 bpm. The beat drops around 40 seconds in. My favorite part is the section from 1:25 to 1:56. :smiley:
--
Also, here's an Audiosurf video of it: [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wBHv46w9Bkk]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wBHv46w9Bkk[/url]
The sidewinder mode in AudioSurf makes my brain hurt, it's so hard to focus on the blocks when the track keeps shifting left and right. x___x

item.title: Drum and Bass in your face!
item.dc:creator: Hamst3r
item.description:
Thanks.

Level:

What sub genre of DnB would you put this under? I’ve been looking for stuff like this for a while.

I read about the DnB sub genres on Wikipedia and I guess it falls under Darkstep, except that it’s pretty melodic, so uh… Not-really-that-darkstep.

item.dc:creator: Hamst3r
item.description:
Holy text block, LamboMan.

LamboMan:

I had asked earlier for the song in the ‘ezmuze+ Hamst3r edition - Trailer 1’

Here ya go: THA-ezmuzetrailer.mp3

It’s the audio directly out of the trailer because I don’t have that mix in any other form.

Read full topic
item.source: Drum and Bass in your face!

item.title: Drum and Bass in your face!
item.dc:creator: LamboMan
item.description:
Hamst3r, I am really loving your songs! Just listened to :

Mode 7
Deep-Fried Dropkick
Making Contact
Impact Event
Linear Implosion
The Fantastical Nikmis
Speed
Marble Madness Remix
EZMHE Demo
Attaining Liberation
Slow Loris
Supremacy
EZMHE Credits HQ Mix

I must say that your work is easily some of the best i’ve heard in a long time.

Your music is really fresh and original and I like the direction in which your newer songs like Solarphage and Making Contact are going. Mode 7 is a pretty good example of how simple electronic sounds can be converted into something magnificent.

I liked the three I just mentioned the most. I also really liked Impact Event, Attaining Liberation, Marble Madness Remix, EZMHE Credits HQ Mix, EZMHE Demo and Supremacy. They were pretty good!

The ones that didn’t really strike a chord with me were Slow Loris, Deep-Fried Dropkick and The Fantastical Nikmis. Although, TBH I think they’re good in their own right, they didn’t fit in much with the rest of the songs i just listened to.

But I must praise your work on the The Fantastical Nikmis, it really sounded like an electro-symphony.

OK, well I had asked earlier for the song in the ‘ezmuze+ Hamst3r edition - Trailer 1’ on YouTube but i think that its a mix of EZMHE Demo and Supremacy, right? Is there any way i can get the version from the video?? Please.

PS: Keep up the great work man! And keep 'em comin!

EDIT: Just heard The End Of Us All! and Reprimand of the Eternal Watchers and i really liked them both. Especially Reprimand of the Eternal Watchers, it’s like an epic movie score and definitely one of you BEST pieces!!

Read full topic

item.title: Drum and Bass in your face!
item.dc:creator: Daedalus
item.description:
Except it uses a gazilion gigabytes of memory when running.
It’s even worse than Itunes.

And VLC is great for the fact it plays nearly every possible extention, and it’s low memory consumption. But it’s interface is shit.
If you want all music in one place for easy listening, without the player taking up half your memory, just use WMP or WinAmp.

Read full topic

Hamst3r:

Check out my latest music track:

Download MP3: THA - Solarphage.mp3

It’s Drum and Bass of the loud and heavy variety. 181 bpm. The beat drops around 40 seconds in. My favorite part is the section from 1:25 to 1:56.

–

Also, here’s an Audiosurf video of it: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wBHv46w9Bkk

The sidewinder mode in AudioSurf makes my brain hurt, it’s so hard to focus on the blocks when the track keeps shifting left and right. x___x

To bad i can’t litsen to it, everything I play in WMP sounds like assmunch in a grinder. :[

item.title: Drum and Bass in your face!
item.dc:creator: LamboMan
item.description:
^Ditto!

I just listened to Mode 7 and I must say I am thoroughly impressed. At first, when I read the description i was a bit skeptical as to “what four Nintendo Game Boy handhelds playing in unison would sound like”.

Man, the transition at 00: 30 was the best part of the song! Excellent work, gonna go check out some more…

item.title: Drum and Bass in your face!
item.dc:creator: Hamst3r
item.description:
Thanks!

LamboMan:

Anyway, the song as whole was truly excellent and I’d really love to hear more of your work.

Thanks, glad you liked the track! There’s a bunch of music on my site. Even a few packs, like the 1997 to 2007 torrent. There’s probably around 250 mp3s if you snag the packs and few individual mp3s.

As for that last part sounding a lot like the first part, they were identical. The only thing missing was a guy shouting, “reeeewinnnnnndddd” to let you know that the song just restarted. :fffuuu:

Daedalus:

I LOVE this one:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-qSnwqxFwwE

Woo! I like that one too. I plan on doing some more like that eventually. :3

Patonki:

Well, the drumbeat was probalby the most generic D&B drumbeat there is.

No no no, I already used the most generic DnB drumbeat there is in another song. This is more like the second or third most generic DnB drumbeat. Jeeeeeeez, get your generic beats straight!

Read full topic
